page.title: 16THE CHURCH
page.content: An early stone church was built 1150, although there may have been a church there previously.The firt vicar was a Master Roger 1235. Of special interest in the church are the Norman tiles in the chancel and south porch, and some good examples of early Elizabethan bricks.The remaining stained glass is of medieval origin.There is one famous brass, much favoured by brass rubbers.The church is in need of much restoration. A programme was begun in 1983,aiming to repoint the tower, and repair lead and beams.The original estimate was put at Â£25,000, but so far stage 1 of a 3 stage plan has alone cost Â£20,000.At present there is an interregnum but the new rector Rev. Girard will soon be responsible for the 3 parishes of Horseheath, Balsham, and West Wickham. Services_ Sun.8_15 attend.Fam. serv.(monthly) 25 attend.
